Academic Computing and Communications Center     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Academic Computing and Communications Center      Academic Computing and Communications Center   Main Menu    Services           Communication and Collaboration    Computing Services    Infrastructure    Professional Services    Research    Security    Teaching and Learning         Support           Academic Continuity    Academic Multimedia Lab and Lightboard Studio    ARC Helpdesk    C-Stop BSB    C-Stop LHS    Daley Library Helpdesk    LTS Support Office         Service Status           Service Notices         News           All News         Forms    About           Identity    Leadership    Policies    Reports    Jobs          Eyebrow menu    WebStore    Online Training    Answers    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Academic Computing and Communications Center    Services    Security    Identity Management    Affiliations        Affiliations  Affiliations provide faculty, staff, students, and external guests with access to necessary services. Faculty, staff, and student affiliations are created as part of the onboarding process. Affiliations expire when the person is no longer associated with the university.  External Affiliations need to be created manually. Departments can set up UIC NetIDs for external affiliates. There are two steps:   Request UINs (University Identification Numbers) for the individuals you want to grant access to from i-card Programs.  Once you have the UINs, locate your unit Phonebook Contact and request them to create the NetIDs. The Phonebook Contact should be able to use the create the external NetID using the ACCC Services for External Affiliates web application. Only they can use that application.
